lead_paragraph: Republicans control most statehouse chambers, but with Donald J. Trump stumbling, Democrats hope for down-ballot gains in Minnesota, Colorado, Nevada and elsewhere.

byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Faribault, and Michael D. Shear from Washington. Mitch Smith contributed reporting from Chicago.
byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

headline.print_headline: Obama Targets G.O.P. Control of Statehouses
headline.main: Obama Assists 150 State Candidates, Targeting G.O.P.’s Grip on Legislatures

snippet: Republicans control most statehouse chambers, but with Donald J. Trump stumbling, Democrats hope for down-ballot gains in Minnesota, Colorado, Nevada and elsewhere....
abstract: Pres Obama is stepping in to help with election efforts of over 150 Democratic state legislature candidates, taking advantage of Donald Trump's destabilizing influence on Republican Party to roll back Republican control at state level; has long way to go, given that Republicans control 68 of nation's 99 state house chambers, compared with 36 at start of 2010, and have pushed through raft of conservative legislation.
